title: "This app can't run on your PC"
body:
I cannot seem to run League of Legends since I updated my PC after the whole NSA/Ransomware debacle earlier this year. My PC was not turned on since sometime last year, so I wan't affected by the virus at all. However, ever since I did update Windows, I cannot seem to launch the League Client. 

When I press the "Launch" button from the Launcher, everything "League" stops then and there(evidenced by the open Task Manager process list). When I try to launch the "LeagueClient" straight from the program list, I just get the "This app can't run on your PC. To find a version for your PC, check with the software publisher." message.

 A lot of people seem to have an XBOX-app-related solution, but I do not see that coming into play anywhere for my situation. When I go to the "Compatibility tab" in the "Properties" for League of Legends, there is not a selectable compatibility mode for Windows 10; the most recent is Windows 8. I've tried re-installing to no avail, and popular user-suggested "fixes," such as running as Administrator and deleting the "lol_patcher" and "lol_launcher" folders prior to opening the shortcut, but nothing has worked. 

If there is an obvious thing that I am missing, I would love to eat my shoes and be told the simple solution. I want to play your game, Riot; please help me do so.

replies.body: I am having the same issue, if there is any solution please let me know.
Hi, I've got the exact same issue. Has this been resolved? Is there a solution?

This sounds like a really peculiar case, and we'd like to take a closer look.  Hit us up in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to get with our tech team so we can dig a bit deeper.  We'll get back to you as soon as we can, hang tight!
